feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Tonight... Northwest winds of 15 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow will continue tonight, then decrease on Saturday. These winds, combined with slightly elevated sea levels, are causing elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Through Monday... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:26AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG OVER NORTHWEST AND NORTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... Areas of fog will reduce the visibility to one quarter mile or less over parts of northwest and north central North Dakota through Saturday morning. Motorists should be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities, and should use extra caution
